meanings.definition: A person or thing that rejects something.
meanings.sent1: The rejectors of the proposal were not convinced by the arguments presented.
meanings.sent2: The rejectors of the job offer had different priorities in mind.
meanings.sent3: The rejectors of the new flavor of ice cream missed out on a delicious treat.
meanings.sent4: The old car served as a rejector of modern technology, refusing to start on cold mornings.
meanings.sent5: The rejectors in the group stood firm in their decision, despite the pressure to agree.

meanings.sent1: The rejectors gathered to discuss their reasons for opposing the plan.
meanings.sent2: The rejectors were united in their stance against the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The rejectors of the team name change had a strong bond with the original one.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds acted as rejectors of the sunlight, casting a shadow over the field.
meanings.sent5: The rejectors stood out in the crowd, their dissenting voices echoing through the room.
